name.value: Greedy Billionaire and the College Student

item.description:
This is a card game where players are College Students trying to graduate before the Greedy Billionaire can take away all their money. They start with a supply of money and will need to pay tuition and other expenses each year (round). They score points for graduating and for avoiding bankruptcy. The Greedy Billionaire is not an actual player but he scores points for each College Student that goes bankrupt.

Players graduate by playing 4 Pass Exam cards (one each for freshman, sophomore, junior and senior year) and one Graduation card. In order to obtain enough money to pay tuition, players may play action cards to get a job, earn a scholarship and receive financial aid. But beware! Their opponents will play Greedy Billionaire Cards to send their job overseas, raise tuition, cut the education budget, pollute the earth, and accuse them of cheating.

Points are tallied at the end of each hand and the final object is to be the first player to score 150 points in several hands of play.

Stranger Danger is a card game for daring people in public places. Challenge your friends to approach a person in the crowd and discover what strangers will do to help you win.

On your turn, draw Stranger cards to describe a person to perform a challenge with. Then select from the Challenge cards you are given by the players on either side of you. To earn points, predict how the stranger will answer a Question or convince them to perform a Request.

name.value: Switch: The Game of Ups and Downs

item.description:
Switch is the exciting game in which three to five players race to play cards in sequence. But watch out! Letters and numbers can go up, down, or stay the same... and switch at any time. Be the first player out of cards and win!

Switch (the predecessor to Qwitch) consists of a deck of 64 cards, each containing one of eight numbers (1–8) and one of eight letters (A–H), and a die with plus, minus, and equals symbols. After hands are dealt, one player turns a card from the deck face up and rolls the die. Players race to play the next card from their hands, determined by the symbol on the die.

The game is played with 12 treasure tiles and a six-sided die. The front of the tiles show various treasures: crown, genie lamp, or goblet. Each tile has one, two, or three treasures of the same type. To start the game, all twelve tiles are placed face down in the playing area.

Three faces of the die show a crown, lamp, and goblet; the other three show the numbers one, two, and three. Players take turns rolling the die, then must turn over a tile with either the same type of treasure (if a treasure was rolled) or the matching number of treasures (if a number was rolled). If the treasure matches, the player keeps it and places it face down in front of her.

Instead of turning over a tile in the center of the playing area, the active player may turn over a tile belonging to an opponent. If the tile matches, the player may steal it and take it into her own area.

The game is played with two sets of cards, one set showing the top half of a ballerina figure in various positions, and the other showing the bottom half. The first player turns over one card of each type forming a complete picture of a ballerina and must imitate the position shown. On subsequent turns, each player must imitate the previous position from memory and then reveal a new one. The players win if they successfully complete the "ballet".

Help, I don’t know who I am!

Amnesia is the fun new card game of lost identities and wacky faces. Players use a mix of memory and deduction to rediscover their identities. The first player to do so is the winner!

				
					Gameplay Overview

Players each hold 4-5 cards in their hand. However, 1 of these cards is only visible to their opponents. The aim of the game is to successfully guess your hidden card (1 of 16 characters).

On their turn, players may ask any 1 opponent how many cards they hold of a particular type (hair colour or face type). Players must answer truthfully and out loud for everyone to hear. As information comes out, players can begin to deduce which character they are (or are not).

Once a player thinks they know which character they are, they can make a guess. If they are correct, they win! If they are wrong, they are knocked out of the game.

Dinos have been spotted in the jungle! You make hasty tracks after them to experience this excitement with your own eyes. But it‘s not very easy to catch sight of these massive ancient creatures. Whoever manages to uncover the sought after dinos and reach the end of the dinosaur footprint path first wins the game.

Each player takes a wooden dinosaur token and places it at the start of a four-tile track. Five dinosaur tiles are shuffled and placed face down in a row on the table. Then in turn, players turn over one of 26 search tiles. If the search tile shows a "trade symbol," the player exchanges two dinosaur tiles without looking at them. If the search tile shows a picture of two or three dinosaurs, the player must turn over an equivalent number of dinosaur tiles. If they match exactly, that player's dinosaur advances on the track. The first player to reach the end of the track wins.

In the "expert" variant, a sixth, blank tile is shuffled in along with the five dinosaur tiles.

Players take turns catapulting egg tiles onto a grid of rabbit tiles. If an egg misses the rabbits, it stays on the table where it landed. If it lands on a rabbit tile, then the player gets to keep the egg along with all eggs of the same color still on the table. The game ends when all 30 eggs have been catapulted, and the player with the most eggs wins.

Twelve chair tiles and twelve guest tiles are placed face-down on the table. On her turn, a player selects one chair tile and one guest tile. If they match, the player scores one point. Otherwise they are returned face-down to the table. When all of the guests are seated, the player who scored the most points wins.

Did you ever feel like your town was a dead end full of mindless drones? Like you just had to get out of there at any cost? Well now you might be right! LocaliZED is a Zombie survival game set in your backyard. It is a 1-8 player co-op game that uses any map and your imagination to turn your neighbourhood in into Zombified blood fest.

LocaliZEd is an open-source print and play game that encourages players to customise their game within the parameters of the core rule set. LocaliZED has players use a map of their hometown, or anywhere else they would like to try and survive a Zombie apocalypse, as the board. On this board a few key locations, church, school, police station are set and then players are given missions at random that force them to interact with these locations while Zombies quickly accumulate on the board.

As the game progresses players draw cards from one common deck that sometimes cause more Zombies to flood the map, sometimes giving the players bonus items and sometimes changing the dynamic of the whole board. 
The game is turn based and the turn sequence runs like this: clockwise players may all move once. Then running clock-wise again, from the same starting player, each player must fight the Zombies in their location once only.
The core mechanic that players use to combat Zombies is really simple. In a location that has Zombies players must roll a D6. If they roll a score greater than the number of Zombies they are fighting then they have won the combat. They may now remove Zombies equal to the difference between their score and the number of Zombies. If they roll a score equal to the number of Zombies this is a draw and nothing happens. If they roll less than the number of Zombies then they have lost the combat and they lose 1 life.
 A roll of a 1 on any dice at any time means they lose the combat. A roll of a 6 on any dice at any time means they may roll an extra dice and count its result towards their score.
 For instance, if there are 4 Zombies in a location and you roll a 5 then you may remove 1 Zombie, because 5 is one greater than 4. If you had rolled a 4 then you would have drawn the combat and nothing would happen. If you had rolled a 6 you may have re-rolled the dice and added the score of the second dice to the original 6 potentially rolling another 6 and gaining yet another re-roll. If you had rolled a 3, 2 or 1 then you would have lost and had to lose 1 life.
 Players may team-up to fight Zombies, and this becomes very necessary. To do this they must be in the same Location. All players who are teaming-up must agree to the team-up before any dice are rolled. The player who’s fighting (because it is their turn) may now roll their dice once only using their weapons. Then they may roll an extra dice for each other player that teamed-up. The player adds the totals together and combats the Zombies with this score. Teaming-up allows players to achieve much higher scores. However, the down side of teaming up is that if they lose the combat everyone in the team-up loses 1 life.

LocaliZED also contains a rather unique mechanic for death. There is no player elimination, instead the dead player switches sides becoming a Zombie and gaining some control of the normally random Zombie deployment.

All of these missions and combat are driving the game towards the Final Mission. This one of 5 set endings for the game that can only be revealed once players have burned through all of the other missions. Final mission are always much harder than the individual missions that lead up to them but they generally involve all of the players working together to achieve them. Final missions range from hiding till the end of the apocalypse, curing the Zombies, killing the other players, or just out right killing all of the Zombies.
The tone of the game is quite tongue in cheek with a lot of the missions and cards having humorous elements. Every part of the game is designed to leave the door wide open for players really take ownership of the scenarios an in-game elements, with blank cards of every type being provided, the onus being on using your own map as a board.

The game was written in response to the Beasts of War websites 2014 Halloween game design challenge. Beasts of War then went on to distribute the game as free down load to all of their members.

Players take turns revealing tiles showing numbers and mathematical operations (addition, subtraction, multiplication, division) and score points for correctly solving the revealed equations. The first player to score four points wins.
Part 10 of the regular Black Stories series without a special theme.
A limited best-of-edition celebrating Black Stories' 10 year anniversary with 100 cards (twice the size of a normal edition) taken from Black Stories 1 through 10.

name.value: Feroces vikingos: ¡A la caza del tesoro!

item.description: Played with a grid of 30 tiles, each showing either a colored treasure or the Loch Ness monster. Players take turns rolling a die, then revealing as many tiles as they wish. The player may keep all treasures that match the color on the die. If at any point the player reveals the Loch Ness monster, then her turn ends and the tiles are returned face-down to the table.

Players simultaneously reveal a set of path cards and attempt to be first to arrange them into a treasure map. Whoever is fastest gets the most valuable treasure. After four rounds, the player with the most treasure wins.

On her turn, a player takes a color card and a picture card. The other players then take turns rolling the dice and asking whether the color and/or picture shown on the dice matches the selected item. Whoever first guesses the correct item gets a bear card, and the first player to collect three bear cards wins.

Adventurers seek to slay a nine headed hydra that has unleashed a myriad of monsters into the world.

This game contains tiles, chits, cards and dice.

Players win the game by either defeating the lead nine headed hydra and/or the head vampiress. The game is lost when all tiles are placed unless using the optional rule for infinite enemies.

To defeat all of the monsters, the players can gather weapons from the item deck by buying them at a shop or by using spells from the spell deck. Some items can also be found when defeating enemies.

The Glorious Fall is a dynamic, competitive/cooperative game with minimized luck. It recreates the entire epic lifespan of the Byzantine Empire, from the founding by Constantine the Great to its last gasp (or not, if you manage to keep it intact).

During play your Dynasty will be given a choice of secret destinies, such as keeping the empire alive, destroying it, or controlling the Basileus through two consecutive Eras, etc., and a number of Byzantine Plot cards to use when you choose. The map consists of the Themes of the Empire, with three "resources" contained in each: people, religious ferver, and commerce.

The game is won by the family accumulating the most Glory Points by the end of the final era in any combination of three ways: fulfilling your Dynasty's unique, secret destinies, developing the Themes (regions) within the empire, and shaping the empire to suit your purposes while denying other's their revealed plans.

Your family will dominate various roles throughout the game: Basileus (Emperor), Logothete (Administrator), Patriarch, Strategos (General), or Katepano (control the mobs of Constantinople). Each title grants limited political power, forcing cooperation, but each can seize unlimited political power at various times when Byzantine Plots are revealed and anyone can suddenly seize control of the Basileus' actions, or even the throne itself.

Roles switch when players reveal plots of various strengths by using Byzantine Plot cards. In essence assassinating the Emperor in favor of their own candidate; misleading an Army sent to defend Jerusalem, convincing it to go to Cilicia instead; or denying the Basileus the power to hand out political favors, instead forcing him to divide the power as your dynasty sees fit.

Each family (player) has only so much political power to expend at any time, and must choose when to intervene and when to let the Basileus (or another family) have their way.

Throughout the game, the Empire faces Barbarian invasions from its borders, and possible rebellions from within. Players will create alliances that may last or end before ever begun as nefarious plots are revealed. The Basileus may see Crusades or merchant enclaves rise up to restore parts of the Empire or betray the Empire and sack the Queen of Cities.

item.description:
Join tiles edge to edge to expand your territory and finally turn your areas into victory points
Watch out though, making your areas too big detracts from your score and can even lead to losing points
Can you keep your areas at just the right size to get the highest score?
It's a territory control game with concise rules and interesting dilemmas

Saboteur: Duel is a standalone version of the famous card game Saboteur for one and two players. When playing alone, you want to collect as much gold as possible by digging new tunnels in the mine; when playing with an opponent, you'll just want to collect more than that player, but naturally your opponent will try to block your progression by all means.

In this card game, you play path or action cards. The path cards form a maze in the direction of the six goal cards, which contain a variable number of gold stones. The action cards are used to hinder your opponent or to help you to repair broken equipment. A greedy troll also lurks in the mine, and you will have to pay him to progress and he doesn't give back any change!

item.description:
You are playing the roles of millionaires who collect mysterious artefacts from the four corners of the earth. Apparently, when collected in threes, these objects have amazing powers. Auctions bore you, so instead you and your rivals have to agree on how to divvy up each load of artefacts. In each round, three objects must be divided up between two players. Each person takes what he or she wishes – if the other person agrees! Is it a deal?

In each round (or Deal), place 3 artefact cards in the middle of the table: 2 face up and 1 face down. Two players must agree on how to divide up these 3 cards. Attention: all the cards must go somewhere; none can be set aside. Cards from previous rounds cannot be exchanged. Negotiations are free and open. They end as soon as both players accept a proposal and say, “DEAL!”
Once an agreement has been reached, the 2 players each take their share and place it behind their own screens. The player who has obtained the face-down card can look at it (secretly or openly) and put it with his or her other cards.
The game ends with there are no more cards in the stack.

item.description:
The Supershow is a wrestling tabletop dice and card game for 2 - 6 players. Supershow is the worlds first UCG, or Unpredictable Card Game, that takes place in the underground wrestling word of the Legendary Fighting Federation. The goal of the game is to hit your finish card for a chance to defeat your opponent.

The Supershow gives players the back and forth excitement of a live wrestling match using its unique turn structure. Players attempt to build up to their Finish cards by using Lead and Follow-up cards. Once you hit one of your three devastating Finish cards you will attempt to keep your opponent down for the three-count, but the match will only end he doesn't break-out. If he breaks-out, then the crowds excitement goes up and the next finish is more likely to end the high-energy match. The simplicity of the rules allow games to last just 5 - 10 minutes, while still being highly competitive and too exciting to just have one match.

The Supershow also has mechanics that for multiplayer formats, three-way, four-way, 2-4 player tag team, tornado tag team, each format can be elimination style or first to Finish. This is on top of different match types that are played with no additional purchases, such as escape the cage or submission match.

With over 90+ players at the Supershow World Championship at GenCon 2017, the Supershow is more than a game you play with some friends, it's a community of players competing year round to have the bragging rights of World Champion. The founders of SRG Universe are life long gaming and wrestling fans and treat the Supershow as a wrestling promotion.

item.description:
Study Parameters
The mind really can shape reality! Scientists have invented a machine that can tap into a person’s dreams and make them real. However, only the strongest minds--those who can control their dreaming--are able to utilize the machine. Thus Project Dreamscape was created to find the ultimate dreamer.

Study Goal
Participants will collect dream cards on their turns with the goal of chaining matching dream types together. The more dream cards a participant chains together, the more points that chain will score. The participant with the most points at the end of the game is the winner!

There are 8 dream types in the 52-card sleep deck, each of which appears exactly 13 times. Each dream card depicts 2 different dream types. Whenever you collect a dream card, you must choose one of the dream types to perform and follow its directions.

item.description:
It will take strengthyness, craftyness and magickyness to be Gameshop Adventurers.

This is a D&D style adventure game for 1 or 2 players.

Needed to play: the deck of 6 cards, 1d20 and 4 eurocubes.

The players work together as a Party of Adventurers to survive their journey and defeat what awaits them in the final room. Each player chooses one Player Card and then which side they wish to use, placing cubes to mark their initial XP and HP.

Each player begins with 2 skills, listed next to their initial XP: STR (Strengthyness) and CRF (Craftyness). All players have a starting STR equal to a D4 and a CRF which will differ depending on which card they chose.

For both STR and CRF, the die rolls will be as stated until you reach a new XP level where they will increase (ex. The Warrior begins with a STR:D4, when he reaches 2 XP this then changes to STR:D5)

The Sorceress and Wizard can also cast magic spells (their Magickyness). There are two types of spells: those in blue can be cast at any time during an Attack; those in red can be cast during an Attack but the player may not use their STR to help (see Attack below) in the Party Attack number. Only one spell may be cast in an Attack.

Each player also begins the game with a Special Skill or Starting Spell which is listed at the bottom of the Player Card.

Attack: Most rooms have a foe in them to be overcome. Attacking is mandatory unless the Wizard uses his Enchantment Spell (in this case the party moves to the next room and there is no attack but the party receives +1XP for being sneaky).

Each player will roll for their STR value separately and both values are then added together. This is the Party Attack number. One player then rolls for the STR of the foe (as listed in the current room). This is the Foe Attack number. If the Party Attack number is equal to or higher than the Foe Attack number, the players win the attack, slay the foe and proceed to the next room, with each player gaining the Success Bonus as listed. If the Party Attack value is lower, each player takes the amount of HP damage as listed and they then proceed to the next room.

Order of Play: The players will proceed from room to room, in numerical order, until they reach the final room where they will be successful and live to fight another day, thereby winning the game, or they will be soundly and utterly defeated.

This is the 4th in a series of Annual Games Unlimited Holiday Games and is the followup to Gameshop Express (2011), Gameshop Workday (2012) and Gameshop Gladiators (2013)

name.value: My Little Pony Rainbow Magic Game

item.description:
This is a cooperative game where players spin and move around a circular board hoping to land on special spaces that allow them to add a piece of the rainbow that will get them to Princess Celestia's party in Canterlot Castle.

But you have to be careful because there's a space on the spinner that will cause a piece of the sky to become stormy. There is also a space on the spinner that will send you to Ponyville, where you will be stuck until someone lands on or spins a heart to get you free.

As a team you must seek to assemble the entire rainbow before the sky becomes completely stormy.

item.description:
From the publisher:

Welcome Battle Commanders! The future of your faction's survival is depending on you! Gain influence and expand your forces to strategically defeat the opposing faction. You win the battle when you reduce your opponent’s health to zero. However, a Battle Commander must be cautious if their opponent is off-initiative. Since Battle for Sularia is a round-based card game, if your opponent is off-initiative, they have the chance to strike back and reduce your health total below theirs and thereby defeating you and winning the game!

FEATURES/GAME PLAY INCLUDES:

Multiple Play Modes
With one box, you and your friend can play with the preconstructed 60 card play decks in a head-to-head 2 player game. The two players can then play in our "60/90" constructed format by customizing their play decks with the additional 60 cards provided in the box! If draft play is more your style, one box also supports 2-4 player draft play! An 8 player draft simply requires one additional box. Of course, the game is fully expandable for a variety of casual play modes – one box supports up to 2 players in casual mode, but there is simply no limit on how many players and formats are available with additional boxes.

Construction Point Values
Unique "60/90" deck construction system. Each card has a construction point value of 1 to 4 points. Each deck must have a minimum of 60 cards and a deck cannot exceed a total construction value of 90 points. This system pushes the envelope on deck construction and maintains value and interests for all cards within the set – not just a few select overpowered options.

Two-resource System
Engaging two-resource system which includes influence and sularium. Influence increases once per round, while each player uses their influence to establish sites on their turn to help build their sularium stockpiles. Sularium is used to deploy combatants, which are used to attack your opponent's sites. The two-resource system in turn provides additional strategies for repeatable game play.

Round-based Game
Simultaneous combat. The game runs on a round-based system, which allows each player to complete their turn before the round is over.

Sularia Protocols (fan expansion to Ophidian 2350 CCG & Battle For Sularia)

item.description:
H2OMG is a fast-paced, simple card game about sneak attacks, soaking your friends, and revenge in last-man-standing a water battle.
 Player have a four-card hand they use to deploy various attacks, such as balloons, buckets, and squirt guns. Each type of attack requires a different number of water cards. The most devastating attacks are also the most work to pull off.
 The last player to sustain 15 points of soak damage the round. The first player to win three rounds wins the game. Rounds last about 5-10 minutes.

microulette is a single card nano game. Each round, players take turns pushing their luck to collect points by rolling the dice and placing bet tokens. The results of two of the three dice are added together. If the player has placed a token on the number that matches that value, the player scores points associated with that spot. Other spots on the card allow the players to mitigate their luck by modifying the outcome of the dice rolls.

item.description:
From the game cover:
"A World War One solitaire and 2-player game. 
Fly against...or as...one of the MONSTERS OF THE AIR!"

This game is a promotional insert in World War One Illustrated, Number 1, a publication of the World War One Historical Association. It was produced by Lombardy Studios, then a part of 1A Games publishing.

The games uses a simple, rock-paper-scissors chit-draw mechanic to simulate a World War One aerial duel between a British BE2c fighter, and a Zeppelin raider that is bombing England. It can be played solitaire, where the player draws randomly for the German Zeppelin, or as a two-player game.

oddball Aeronauts 2 : Double the Trouble can be played standalone out of the box or it forms an addition to the oddball Aeronauts card game - a simple, light strategy, played-in-the-hand (no surface required) card game of hi-jinks airship dogfights, set in an oddball fantasy world. Players take their airship officers, crew and bots, and go head-to-head in a duel in the sky of an oddball, steampunk-esque world.

oddball Aeronauts 2 : Double the Trouble adds 2 new factions to the game - the Mechinauts and the Free Kingdoms - as well as rules for 3 or 4 players.

Note - by downloading the rules to the original oddball Aeronauts game, you can play oddball Aeronauts 2 : Double the Trouble as a 2 player game right out of the box with no need to purchase the original game.

item.description:
Mistfall is a fully co-operative adventure game set in a fantasy world of mystery, eldritch powers and high adventure.

At the start of the game each player chooses a hero with a fixed deck of equipment and power cards, before embarking on a dangerous journey through a set of monster-ridden locations. Each hero also comes with a pool of advanced abilities that can be added to their basic deck during the game to customize and expand their powers. A variable board setup, randomized encounters and enemies, a simple but robust monster AI – all that makes for a game that is a varied and challenging experience both solitaire as well as with a group of up to three friends.

Gather up your resolve, check your gear and get ready to brave the unrelenting Mists. A world of perilous adventures awaits!

item.description:
Overview from the publisher:

Monster extermination is a game for 2 to 3 players to discover who is the best Monster Hunter.
Each player use six different magic weapons to repeal 30 different monsters.
Who's the best hunter of them all ?
It's time to find out.
Let's get started

From publisher overview:

Battle with five elemental dragons in this epic card game.
Choose your card well and defend yourself !
Be the first to discard all your card to win the game.

Easy to learn and easy to play.

Straight out of the Firefly 'verse comes Firefly: Tall Card! With rules and artwork inspired by the game played on Firefly, Tall Card will make you feel like you're a fellow crew member aboard Serenity! Each box contains a 66-card deck, including the round "Tall Cards" as seen on Firefly! Also included are more than 50 additional cards so you can create other Tall Card variants.

The gameplay is similar to draw poker, but the suits are inspired by Mah Jong tiles so the composition of the deck is very different from a standard 52-card deck.

item.description:
In Toy Vault's Princess Bride-opoly, you and your friends venture inside the classic fantasy film, 'The Princess Bride' !

Sail across the Shrieking Eel-infested waters! Traverse the deadly Fire Swamp! Storm the mighty castle! Buy up properties as you quest across the kingdom and build them up with cottages and castles in order to collect valuable Florins from the other players who follow.

Be careful however, because a bad roll of the dice could leave you paying a heavy fee, dueling another player, or thrown into the Pit of Despair!

For 2-5 players, Princess Bride-opoly is board game of buying and selling properties. Players take turns moving around the board buying up properties featured in the movie. Properties can be upgraded with cottages and castles, which provide more income if another player lands on them. If you can be the last player with Florins, you win the game!

Your story - your rules!

Zombies wherever you look. Nobody knows Where they come from and what they want. Mindless, hungry and unstoppable, they hunt the living. Zombies! All that's left is to arm yourself to the teeth just to see another day. You are part of a group of survivors, trying to fight against overpowering Undead. All for one, or maybe sacrifice one for all? Where do the Zombies come from, and how can you get rid of them? Maybe they are part of a bigger plan? Make your own story and see for yourself what happens.

Zombia is a narrative card game in the Mini Story series by Noris Spiele. Cards determine their role, their relations to each other and their secret goals. A game last over five rounds, after which the winner(s) are identified as related to their goals.

Your story - your rules!

Rumors tell of a legendary pirate treasure. In the small tavern "Pirate Bay" several treasure hunters have gathered on their hunt for fame, rum and gold. Together, alone or in ever changing teams they will try to reach their goal. But beware: betrayal and deceit lurk on every corner. Who will find the pirate treasure? Who will survive its discovery? And how can the hunters leave the island again? Make your own story and see for yourself what happens.

Pirate bay is a narrative card game in the Mini Story series by Noris Spiele. Cards determine their role, their relations to each other and their secret goals. A game last over five rounds, after which the winner(s) are identified as related to their goals.

item.description:
Your story - your rules!

Area 51. Im Jahr 1956 wird die verlassene Basis plötzlich wiederbelebt. Zwischenfälle mit abgestürzten „Heißluftballons“, Gerüchte von Ufosichtungen und paranormale Phänomene häufen sich schlagartig in den folgenden Monaten in diesem Gebiet. Allerlei Spekulationen und wilde Gerüchte kursieren. Doch eigentlich ist eines allen irgendwie klar: Die Aliens sind gelandet. Nur wer sind sie, und wem kannst du trauen?

Area 51. In 1956 the abandoned base all of a sudden came back to life again. In the following months, more and more rumours arise of crashed hot-air balloons, ufo sightings and paranormal phenomenons. Speculations and wild reports circulate. But everyone agrees on one thing: The aliens have landed. But who are they, and whom can you trust? Make your own story and see for yourself what happens.

Ufo Attacks is a narrative card game in the Mini Story series by Noris Spiele. Cards determine their role, their relations to each other and their secret goals. A game last over five rounds, after which the winner(s) are identified as related to their goals.

Your story - your rules!

A grand social event is at hand. Arthur Devenhorst, heir of the time-honoured country estate of Bedsparypark has announced his wedding with Amie Winters, nursemaid of a neigbouring manor. But the festivities are ill-fated, for his father is distressed about his son's choice. And other influential persons want to marry into the Devenhorst family themselves. Will love triumph? Will his adversaries be successful? Or will the couple fall victim to its own secret past? Make your own story and see for yourself what happens.

Wedding at Bedsparypark is a narrative card game in the Mini Story series by Noris Spiele. Cards determine their role, their relations to each other and their secret goals. A game last over five rounds, after which the winner(s) are identified as related to their goals.

Your story - your rules!

Rumours of the mysterious research station "OMEGA" make their rounds within scientific circles. Secret experiments during the war are said to have unearthed discoveries beyond the wildest dreams of any scientist. But all of a sudden all contact to the station broke off. Nobody knows what became of the researchers or the station. Now, 20 years after the end of the war, hints to "OMEGA" surface again, while you try to look into it. What is behind all this? What secrets may "OMEGA" hold? And who will get to use them? Make your own story and see for yourself what happens.

Die verlassene Forschungsstation (The abandonded Research Station) is a narrative card game in the Mini Story series by Noris Spiele. Cards determine their role, their relations to each other and their secret goals. A game last over five rounds, after which the winner(s) are identified as related to their goals.

Play Rugby is a rugby game. Players move their pawn on the board using action cards. Some actions require a dice roll to succeed. If you fail, the ball is lost. You can also rob the ball from the opponent using an action card.

Lineout, scrum, drop, penalty... all of rugby is in the game.

This game includes 4 different playing options:

I. Turno-Race: The tiles form a race track (see box cover). Movement is determined by a die. If a player gets on a tile with an even number of dots, he turns the tile and advances as many tiles as dots show up. If a player rolls an odd number, he hast to go backward and may not turn the tile.

II. Turno-Lottery: The tiles form a 6-pointed star. The players place their meeple on a tile. If the die shows the number of their tile, they may remove the tile. The first player to remove all 6 tiles of his leg of the star, wins the game.

III. Turno-Domino: The 6-edged center tile is placed on the table. The players draw tiles and add one at a time to the center tile, till a six pointed star is formed. The first player to use up all his tiles wins the game.

IV. Turno-Boardgame: The 36 tiles combine to a game board of 6x6 tiles. The meeples start on a corner tile, have to cross the board to any tile on the other side and return to their starting tile, to win the game. Movement is determined by a die. If a player, for instance, rolls a 5 he can advance to a neighbouring tile, that shows 5 dots, or he can go to a tile showing 3 dots and further to a tile showing 2 dots.

From the rulebook:

Rules for 20mm World War II through Present Conflicts

These rules are designed to re-enact table top combat for the Foot Soldier. Each figure on the board represents one Infantryman with his own type of weapon, each having a morale level of his own.

The game of escape of the famous painter Rikanati in Venice in 1756!

The aim of the game is to discover with your Lord, the famous painter Rikanati and secure him to your palace,before he was discovered by the Doge.

Preparing the Game
Each player chooses one of the colored palaces and a medallion of the same color.
Pawns / figures, mix well so that no players may not know what the playing figure is positioned Rikanati.
Each player chooses a pawn / figure and places it in the Gondolas.
Hangs the medallion has chosen in his figures to standout and placed in front of the palace.
The other figures that do not belong to a player, placed by all players, depending on their preference, in seven theaters.
In each theater is placed only a figure!
Now nobody knows where exactly hiding Rikanati!!!
There is chance to be already below the figure of any players.
The remaining permits gondolas placed by player to the dock preferences.On each pier is placed a gondola!

Now mix the jewelery cards.
A player gets up the card that is above the rest and thus determines which player will start first the game.
Then each player gets the card jewelry that corresponds to him.
When you play less than three players remaining cards are placed back in the box.

The motion in channels and alleys

If it's your turn to play, you can move all three gondolas.
Each time you move a gondola from a pier in a another should be keeping the following:

1) The three movements may preferably split them either in your own gondola with your pawn,either in empty gondolas.
 But you never move a gondola which standing pawn of other players.

2) On each pier is placed a gondola along.
Each pier has a column.The position of the column shows
(in case of doubt) in which channel belongs the pier.

3)No allowed the overtaking of the pier if there is another gondola stopped.Exceptions are the five palaces and palace of the Doge.

4)After moving the gondolas, in continuation of your turn you move your pawn.
You can download your pawns from the gondola,to cross an alley to reach the next pier and if there is free gondolas upload your pawns and continue wandering in Venice.

5)Every time your pawn arrives at an alley, you can cross it until the end.
With dexterous movements in alleys and moving appropriate the gondolas you can move very quickly your pawns.
When intersecting alleys, is not allowed to change course.

6)At the end of your turn should your pawn park again in a gondola.The game continues with the searching of Rikanati.

7) As your figure crosses with the gondola the board of the game
is looking the gondolas and theaters for Rikanati.
Looks rapidly under the cloak of the other figures which is parked there.

Rikanati is on another gondola

1) To find Rikanati you must reach your figure to a pier,
 you cross the alley and you met a another figure which probably can be hidden Rikanati.You take the two figures (your own and that you meet) and examined them under the table.

2) If you discover under the cloak of the figure that you met 
or even your own figure, the Rikanati(namely...the white nail)
you can change the medallion secretly and this way bring the Rikanati in your own pawn.
Place the pawn back in gondolas are parked on the pier and return your pawn in your own gondola after walking rear in the alley.

Rikanati located in theater

If you discover Rikanati in theater you can change again the medallion secretly and bring him to your gondola.

Bribery

Before you transport Rikanati in your palace with safety, you must bribe the Doge to withdraws his pursuers.
Therefore you must pass your figure from the palace of the Doge and leave it at a jewelry card.

Winner

The player who manages to get to his palace with Rikanati, is the winner of the game. For confirmation shows the lower part of the figure to the other players.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
The Bloody Fields of Mollwitz is the first game in the tactical battle series entitled The Battles of Enlightenment, representing the first battle of Frederick II, King of Prussia.
Game scale:
1 hex = 120 m (131 yards),
1 game turn = 30 minutes
1 counter = infantry battalion/cavalry squadron (hussars: 1 counter = two sqds)/artillery battery.
Game description

The game is divided only on the activation phases, in which the players first can change the order of the commander, and then move troops belonging to the commanders of the wings or infantry line (the same are treated Hussars regiments and artillery). 
In each activation phase players:
1) use their Commanders-in-Chief and dispatch riders to give orders to subordinate commanders;
2) activate infantry / cavalry or artillery moving it first and then carrying out the combat. Inactive player may respond by performing cavalry countercharges; infantry can react with fire. Also in this phase employed to rally broken units and moving commander-in-chiefs.

The principle of the game is based on an order system. The player must carry out the assigned order (of course, he gives them to himself), until the order is changed by the Commander-in-Chief, or the wing/line commander manages to change it by himself.
The possible orders are: STOP, MARCH, ATTACK. 
In the historical scenario it will be possible to give two additional orders: MARCH (IN MARCH COLUMN); DEVELOP.
The game distinguishes the tactics used by the Prussian and Austrian armies, with particular emphasis on platoon fire combat used by the Prussian infantry.
Zone of Control works similarly to other games with the exception that the infantry ZoC does not stop cavalry units, but allows the infantry to fire at the moving cavalry.
Movement is identical as in other games in the hex-and-counter system.
The game discerns fire combat and melee combat.
Infantry and artillery fire combat is based on the shooting unit current morale level - it results in a loss of morale level of the fired upon opponent. 
Melee combat is based on morale checks: first the attacker checks his morale, if he gets a positive result he initiates the melee combat. Then the defender checks his morale and if his result is positive the attacker checks his morale again (by checking the effects of the lack of success).
Cavalry (except hussars) can only attack in melee. Their attacks are resolved in the same way as infantry melee combat (with the exception resulting from the option to counterattack).
The loss of morale level is indicated with special markers.
When the unit loses morale is broken.

There will be four scenarios in this game:
Initial – a training scenario,
Historical - with General Roemer and his cavalry on the map - the rest of the Austrian army enters the map in the course of the game,
Hypothetical 1 and 2 - two armies face themselves already developed on the battlefield.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description: Join the SimplyFun Buddies for a hoppin’ good time! Buddy Hop features two game in one! Game one concentrates on building your child’s memory and sequencing skills, while game two concentrates on building quick visual association skills. The durable, soft foam Character Mats are great for indoor and outdoor play.

This is two games in one! One side of board matches the color tokens to the color of Huey’s shoes and for more advanced play turn the board over and match the color tokens to the correct color word. If you already have this token on your board you get to pass it onto another player! Be the first player to fill up all of the spaces on your Huey board and win!

There is no "taking turns" in Corner Center Match! All players race to match the corner on their cards to the shape and color on the card in the center of the table. Don't forget to check the back sides of your cards if you get stuck, but be quick!

A quick trivia game.
The Quizmaster reads a question ands everyone else answers in writing at the same time. The first player to give the right answer scores. To determine the right answer the player are writing on some pads, that fold into the middle if released. The bottom pad was released first.

How fast can you match and add your cards to go from 15 Cards To Zero? Win the game by being the first player to get rid of his or her Number Cards by matching them to an individual number on a single die or the sum of two or more dice each turn. The first to match can discard those cards from their hand to get to zero before the other players.

It’s a Grill Party and everyone has their own idea about what foods to grill! Place and swap Grill Food Pieces on the Grill to try to match situations depicted on your Grill Food Cards. Be the first player to match all of your Grill Food Cards to become the Grill Master!

Step right up and roll the dice! This colorful “boardwalk” theme creates a fun carnival like game experience. Roll as many times as you like to try to match the sum on the Number Cards but be careful there is a price to pay!

Roll dice and combine their sums to match target sums displayed on number cards. Collect the number cards you match and secure their points if no other player can match their target sum that round. Secure the most points by the end of the game to win!

Take a fast paced ride down the Letter Slide!

Don't "slide" by the letter tiles that you need. Spell as many words as you can based on the card that has been turned over. Hurry before the timer runs out!

Grab Letter Tiles to complete as many four-letter words as you can before the time runs out. Place one Letter Tile from each correctly spelled word onto a corresponding letter space. Cover all the Letter Spaces on your Slide Board first to win the game!

It's all about Perspective!!

Move the brightly colored Game Tiles around on the board to create one or more patterns from your “Perspective”. Solve your Pattern Cards even when it is not your turn but pay close attention and be quick so you do not miss out on a winning opportunity!

Match the Pattern Cards to patterns on the Game Board to earn points. Move Game Tiles to create new patterns and opportunities for more points. Score the most points from matched patterns to win Perspectives!

Who's Like Me? You may be surprised how much we all have in common.

In Who's Like Me?, children learn how to recognize emotions in their friends and see what they all have in common. This game develops skills like observation, memory, distinguishing and grouping multiple elements, and sharing emotions. Make matches and earn points. Score the most points and win the game!

The animals are loose and must be brought back into the enclosures as fast as possible. If only someone could remember where the animals were last!

Dash quickly as you and the other players turn over tiles to collect pairs of animals. Find pairs according to the Goal Tiles. Match a valid pair and receive a positive point, collect a wrong pair and receive a negative point. Score the most points at the end of 3 rounds and win!

For each game, the set up and game play is the same, but the game objectives are slightly different. In the Bubbles game, the last player to have at least one Bubbles Tile left in their section wins the game! In the Puddles game, the first player to remove all the Puddle Tiles from their section wins the game!

Roll the Die to move the Rubber Duck and discard the Tile where the Rubber Duck lands. Replace a Tile from the discard pile when you roll the Duck Symbol. To Win the Bubbles game be the last player with a Tile left in Play. To win the Puddles game be the first player to remove all your Tiles.

Help your birdies fly home as they collect tasty tidbits of food to move around the landscape tiles.

As your birds move ahead, reveal more of the landscape tiles opening new paths to explore. Try to reach your nest with as much food energy as you can. The bird who reaches the nest with the most food wins!

In Cross Lanes, place your card at a 90 degree angle covering a card value that is one higher or one lower than the value of your card. Cover two halves in any orientation and score a Spare or a Strike. Be the first player to place all of your cards and win the game. Be careful if you don't have a play or a Gutterball may be headed your way!

Exercise your math factoring skills and make your horse the Front Runner. The first horse to cross the finish line wins the race. Solve equations using the dice by plugging in the missing numbers needed to solve the equation.

Feeling fearless? Use a Second Wind card to re-roll the dice and try again. Falling behind? Use a Nose Ahead card for a chance to make up some ground. Solving for multiple operators? Follow the 3 rules for Order of Operations and run a smooth race.

Fourmation is an amazing new game that elegantly combines math with strategy.

The object is to connect four zones in a row: up, down or diagonally. But in order to place your colored marker, you'll have to make the number on the desired spot from the sum of one or more of the number cards in your hand. Outnumber all other players in a contested zone to put it back under your control and complete the winning "fourmation"!

The game board can be turned and rearranged to create a different layout every time. This is a fun alternative to flash cards for upper level addition that your kids will love.

Tibbar is painting the town red, and orange... and even blue-green!

In Mix to Match, your kids will learn how to combine colors to create secondary and tertiary shades. Send Tibbar around his painter's palette to get to the color shown on one of your cards. Match all of your colors first to win the game.

In this game, your challenge is to build or share a roadway built by others to navigate from one side of the board to the other. Drop a traffic cone to protect a route you like, or "Bypass" one you don't. Make sure to watch for other players' roadways to 'break' them up before they have a complete route. Be the first person to complete a route to win.

On each turn, play one of your roadway tiles somewhere on the game board. You don't have to play the tiles in any particular order, and your route doesn't need to be straight - but over the twists and turns it must eventually create a path joining your color on both sides of the game board. Remember that all players share the roadway system, so try not to help someone finish ahead of you. After playing a roadway tile, draw a replacement and then the next player on your left takes their turn. Only after a tile has been surrounded on all four sides, players may stack a different tile on top of it, changing the route dramatically!

Objective: Be the first reaching space 100; become really positive about Germany's war occurences
- moving by turns -

All players have to buy in first. Each player moves forward according die roll. Ending on red spaces you must pay or collect play money, skip a turn or move again...

Note:
Likely published ~1915; indoctrination related to spirit of the age & time

In Geheimtraining (secret training) you try to pass the ball which is a disc to your team mates by flickikng it. Around each player pawn lies a rubberband to indicate the area in which you have to land the ball to successfully pass it.

The player who passes 11 perfect shots and shoots a goal wins the game.

Objective: Be the first reaching Paris (space 46); become really positive about Germany's war occurences
- moving by turns -

All players have to buy in first. Board shows German/French/Belgium Border with two separate ways (Aachen or Metz) towards Paris.
Choose one of the two routes. Each player moves forward according die roll. Ending on red marked spaces you must pay or collect play money, skip a turn or move again...
Note:
Likely published 1915; indoctrination related to spirit of the age & time

Objective: Flip carton discs into areas of different values in the box base and colored circles of the erected castle.

Instructions show relations to events of WWI: 
Cannon (on the cover) is described as "Krupp's 42 cm mortar", successfully used during WWI.

From the publisher's website:

No smoke, no mirrors, just a great game!

What: Dungeon Crawl

Scale: 1 figure or counter represents 1 man or creature

Your Role: Players lead a party of Adventurers into a dungeon in search of Treasure and Fame. Save the Princess, kill some Monsters or grab some Loot, the choice is yours!

Playability: Designed for solo, same side and head to head play.

2 Hour Dungeon Crawl can be played in a variety of ways and contains the following:

 Fifteen different Races including Dwarves, Elves, Orcs, Trolls, Wizards, Barbarians, and much more.
 Eight different Professions to breath life into your characters. 
 Rules for your characters to grow in skills and abilities as they succeed.
 30+ Attributes to further define your characters.
 Over 30 Magic Spells and Magical items for you to find and use.
 A system that generates your dungeons, including the Monsters, while you play.




And even better.

Have those cool Dungeon Tiles? You can use them.

Want to go Old School and use Graph Paper? You can do it.

Have metal figures? Plastics? How about paper? Even counters? Yep, you can use them all.

Why?

Because it shouldn't cost an arm and leg for a great Dungeon Crawl...unless you run into a Troll!

2 Hour Dungeon Crawl
No smoke, no mirrors, just a great game.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
Shut the Front Door is a simultaneously turned, fast paced matching game about childish insults. The deck contains 50 cards each with 6 childish insults and one compliment on them. There are 30 different insults spread among the cards.

The rules contain several variants but the main mechanic of each is to find matching words between cards, shout it out (Cootiehead!) and discard or add the cards to another pile faster than the other players. Variant rules include relay races, shouting out only the compliments, penalties for making mistakes and even drinking games for adult players.

Other decks in the series, available separately, share the same rules but have words with different themes such as Sci-Fi or Shakespearean insults.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
Köbes is a board game for two to four players from 12 years of age. The game is played in the dining room of a typical Cologne brewery/pub. Players assume the role of Köbes, a waiter who serves Kölsch (name used to describe beer in Cologne and Bonn). Each Köbes is his own entrepreneur. He must bring as many Kölsch as possible to the tables of his guests, that he previously purchased at the bar from the host brewer. But it's not as simple as it sounds, as there are always many obstacles in the way.

The game bases its mechanics on the well known and loved game Mensch Ärger Dich Nicht, which uses dice to move around the board. In Köbes, players also use dice rolls to advance their Köbes around the brewery/pub, but are not limited to just the rolled dice numbers.

A dexterity game.

NOTE: Nervíky (Czech/Slovak) = nerves (to be more precise: little nerves).

Set-up: One player (the catcher) has a small cup, and a die with different colours on its faces. The other players each have a differently-coloured wooden piece (yellow, red, green, or blue) with a string attached to it.

Aim of the game: Players try to receive the least amount of penalty points for their poor reaction times.

Game play:

Variant no. 1

The catcher rolls the die, if the roll is yellow, red, green, or blue, he/she tries to catch, with his/her cup, the colour rolled. If he/she rolls white, he/she attempts to catch all of the colours; if he/she rolls black, he/she is not allowed to catch anything. The other players, according to the result of the roll, either try to escape (by pulling on the string) or do nothing.

Variant no. 2

The catcher says three colours at random (e.g., green, blue, black) and rolls the die. 
If he/she rolls one of the colours he/she said, he/she tries to catch as many of the other players as possible and the other players try to escape as quickly as possible (again by pulling on the string). If the catcher rolls a different colour than he/she said, the other players do nothing.

Scoring Points:

There is a penalty point to the catcher if he/she does not catch any of the other players, or if he/she accidentally catches any of the other players.

There is a penalty point to the other players (with coloured pieces with strings) if they are caught by the catcher, or if they accidentally pull their pieces back.

The players place their 15 meeples on the game board, one per turn. When all meeples are on the board the players move their meeples one space at a time. When a player gets 5 of his meeples in a straight line, he may remove any one meeple of any opposing player. If he does this on the black spaces, forming the name "Erika" he may additionaly reenter one of his own removed meeples. If a player manages to occupy the "Erika" spaces of his own color, he wins the game. Another possible way to win the game is to occupy any black "Erika" spaces, the two spaces left and the two spaces right to the letter "I" in "Erika" (forming a cross).

Challenge someone to a battle of words!

In Word Bits, words begin as one to four letter bits rolled on the letter dice. Pick a category card and make a word using those word bits that fit the category. Everyone plays at once, so be the first to call out your word to win the card. This game promotes quick thinking while building spelling and vocabulary skills

Turn over the top card. It will show how many dice to roll (from 1 to 4) and a general category. After throwing the dice,all players must quickly try to think of a single word that fits the category and includes all the letters shown. For example the two letters A and C and the category "Breakfast Food" might lead to "bacon", "cereal", "pancakes" or even "cantaloupe". The fastest player receives the card and then turns over a card for the next round. At the end of the deck, the player who collected the most cards wins the game.

name.value: Night Fight: Solitaire East Front Tactics

item.description:
Night Fight: Solitaire East Front Tactics is a solitaire wargame in which you command a Kampfgruppe group of German panzers infiltrating and attacking Soviet forces at night while the system runs the Soviet forces. The first scenario is based on an actual night action from the Battle of Kursk during elements of 6th Panzer Division infiltrated behind Soviet lines. There are also several other scenarios representing other night fights on the eastern front in 1943.

Each vehicle counter represents up to five tanks or other vehicles, depending on the scenario. Each map hex represents 30 meters. Each turn represents anywhere from two to 15 minutes depending on the tempo of your activities.

Panzers East Solitaire (PES) is simulation that covers the advance of Germany’s Army Group Center, starting on the first day of Operation Barbarossa and potentially extending to the last day of August later that same summer. The design supports both strict historical and alternative history explorations. That is, at the end of July, when the AGC offensive was historically shut down in favor of supporting extended drives by the flanking army groups, it’s possible that, if you’ve done better up to then than your historical counterpart, Hitler may authorize a continued and immediate advance on Moscow. You command the German forces while the system directs the handling of Soviet forces. You win or lose based on the timely seizure of key areas on the map.

Each game turn equals one-third of a month. Each hexagon represents 16 miles (24 km) from side to opposite side.

Components: One 22" x 34" map & 280 counters

World at War Magazine #45, DEC 2015 – JAN 2016

Modern War #19, Sept-Oct 2015

It was the Chinese scholar-historian Wei Yuan, writing in the mid-19th century, who first formally identified his nation’s apparently inescapable cycles of “chaos and humiliation” (quru), followed by “rejuvenation” (fuxiang), followed by “wealth and power” (fuqiang), and then back to quru to start again. More recently, Queens College futurist and sometimes-CIA analyst Dr. Bruce Bueno de Mosquita wrote concerning China that he sees no factors in the present-day environment working to end or deflect that same cycle. It was the shared conclusions of those two men, working over a century-and-a-half apart, which inspired me to design this wargame modeling the military parameters and possibilities inherent in the next phase of Chinese quru – civil war.

The likely starting points for such a conflict would either be the collapse of the Chinese real estate bubble – which is already broadly predicted to be inescapable and will constitute the largest financial collapse in world history – or the growing potable water crisis. (A third of the water consumed by the Chinese is undrinkable by US standards.) Beyond those factors, or in combination with them, there’s also the gender imbalance, the fossil fuel air pollution crisis, the increasingly endemic corruption, the aging population structure, the expanding rural-urban economic gap, as well as the general collapse of ideology and the resultant moral lapse throughout the populace. One, some, or all of these factors may eventually lead to a crisis in China, as so often occurs in history, resulting in a civil war.

Each turn equals two months, probably starting sometime late in this decade or early in the next. The game is designed for two players, but it is adaptable for solitaire. Each hexagon on the 34x22” map represents 80 miles from side to opposite side. Units of maneuver are brigades, divisions and group armies and air corps (in the form of 176 large-size NATO-style counters).

Components: One 22" x 34" map & 176 counters.

Objective: As a hero - collect as much gold as possible;
as dragon - catch all heros; game ends after all gold is collected or all heros are caught/out of the game.
 - acting by turns -
The dragon is placed in the centre of the board, each hero with two pieces of gold on his starting position; remaining gold (4 pieces) are placed at the far end of the cave.
Players move according die roll forward, laterally or backwards.
A '6' can be used only passing (stepping over) the dragon, otherwise not usable. Reaching a piece of gold it should be brought back to starting position. 
After each player's turn the dragon will move segmentally according die roll. A player hit by dragon's head is out of the game - unless he/she can pay a ransom (1 gold).

note:
likely published mid 1950's

Set Schnupperspiel or Set Demo Deck is a small, promotional copy of Set! containing 27 cards.

In SET, each card contains 1-3 objects, with all of the objects on a card having the same color, shape and shading. Colours, shapes, and shadings come in three different types: green, purple and red; oval, diamond and squiggle. As opposed to the original game, there is only one type of shading; solid.

The object of the game is to create sets of 3 cards that are either all alike or all different.

The Set Schnupperspiel, or Set Demo Deck, was available at the AMIGO Spiel + Freizeit GmbH booth, at Spiel '14, as a freebie.

The Set Schnupperspiel was also available in Stadt Land Spielt! Sonderdrucke 2018 as part of that games package.

name.value: Gunslinger: Legends of the Dusty Trail

item.description:
Around the time of the Civil War and following, the American West was certainly a wild place. Although it was sparsely populated, many of the inhabitants were desperate and dangerous. The West had always been home to large groups of American natives, but now had been receiving various undesirables such as cattle rustlers, gamblers, vigilantes, and banditos. For the most part, those coming West were hungry for gold and were willing to do just about anything to get it. Many found it too tiresome trying to get rich panning and digging, and instead found it more convenient to steal or kill for it. As a consequence, it became the common practice not only for nearly everyone to carry a firearm, but also for nearly everyone to use one. Needless to say gangs, posses, and gunfights were common parts of every day life. Anybody with a gun had an opportunity to make a name and gain infamy in the great American West.

It is exactly this setting in which you find yourself in. You have the option of choosing one of seven notorious gunfighters of the old American West: Kid Rango, Chief War Wind, Pablo ‘The Pistol’ Perez, Walter Winston, Raging Arrow, Luther ‘The Lawman’ Hale, or Little Pancho. Besides the 7 posse bosses, Gunslinger: Legends of the Dusty Trail also comes with an additional 42 gunfighters. Each boss and gunfighter comes with their own mugshot and unique battle stats. With your posse boss, recruit a gang from the various cities to ride out to face your rivals. Dodge ruthless banditos, determined lawmen, and hostile natives to get to your next gig. You can knock off the Bank of the Nation, rustle up some cattle, or take on the Union Pacific Railroad. You can also track down the other gunslingers to collect the bounties on their heads. The way you stack your posse, the strategy you employ, and knowing when to strike will always give you the edge. Each boss comes with his own clutch skills that come in handy when the chips are down. No matter how many times you play, the scenarios are endless and the game never looks the same twice. The winner is the posse that bags the most gold, even if they end up in pine boxes.

With Gunslinger: Legends of the Dusty Trail, you get three distinct games in the Gunslinger series. You get everything you need to play Gunslinger Shootout (arena style combat), Gunslinger Showdown (mano y mano confrontation), and Gunslinger Roundup (recruit your posse, collect the bounties, and get the gold). Anybody can get lucky and be a hero! It takes one shot in the right spot.

item.description:
Overview
What Da Blank is a question-based card game where you and your friends are put in messed up situations and you get to come up with the best or worst answers or stories to make your friends laugh their butts off! It's really a game for friends to have laughter-filled, honest, friendship-insulting fun!

Rules
1. The player with the least hair will start the game by taking a card form the top of the deck.
2. The player will then read the question to the group, replacing the blank with his/her name.
3. The other players will then take turns to give their best/most messed up answers they can think of.
4. The player will then pick the answer that he/she feels is the best answer and awards that person the card.
5. The next player will then take another card from the deck and the game continues.

Win Condition
The first player to get 3 cards wins the game! When a player has won, all cards will return to the deck and the deck will be reshuffled to "reset" the game.

Minus Cards
If any player draws a minus card, they must return the minus card and any two cards on their hand to the bottom of the deck. That player's turn is now over and the next player continues the game by taking a card from the deck.

Community Aspect
What makes What da Blank special is that most (if not all) the questions in the game were conceived from the creators' friends! Seeing this, the creators want to incorporate more questions into future expansions by getting crazy questions from the community to make a game that is truly community-inspired!

Non-CCG card game for two people.

Explore the world in which swords chop to the left and right, while men screaming off their lungs. World of mighty Karmazyns and Brotherhood. World of XVII-century Poland. World of Noble Card Game VETO!

Starting the game in Veto The confrontation, you can choose whether you stand on the side of a knightly family of Michael Volodyovski headed, or insidious Radziwill, where the first saber is Andrew Kmicic. Your actions can support Jeremy WiÅ›niowiecki or treacherous brothers Radziwill in the struggle for the throne of Poland. By hook or by crook you will agitate and challenge to duels their rivals.

Do not have pity for the vanquished! Grab throne for yourself!

This is a standalone game, based on CCG Szlachecka Gra Karciana VETO! (Noble Card Game VETO!) and contains two complete decks of 55 cards, 28 ducat tokens, 15 stroke tokens and instruction.

----- Polish genuine description -----

Poznaj Å›wiat, w którym szablami rÄ…bie siÄ™ na lewo i prawo, gardÅ‚ujÄ…c przy tym wniebogÅ‚osy. Åšwiat moÅ¼nych Karmazynów i odwaÅ¼nych Panów Braci. Åšwiat XVII-wiecznej Polski. Åšwiat Szlacheckiej Gry Karcianej VETO!

ZaczynajÄ…c grÄ™ w Veto Konfrontacja, moÅ¼esz wybraÄ‡, czy staniesz po stronie rycerskiego rodu WiÅ›niowieckich z MichaÅ‚em WoÅ‚odyjowskim na czele, czy podstÄ™pnych RadziwiÅ‚Å‚ów, gdzie pierwszÄ… szablÄ… jest Andrzej Kmicic. Twoje dziaÅ‚ania mogÄ… wesprzeÄ‡ Jeremiego WiÅ›niowieckiego bÄ…dÅº zdradzieckich braci RadziwiÅ‚Å‚ów w walce o tron Rzeczypospolitej. Nie przebierajÄ…c w Å›rodkach bÄ™dziesz agitowaÅ‚ i wyzywaÅ‚ na pojedynki swoich rywali.

Nie miej litoÅ›ci dla pokonanych! Zagarnij tron dla siebie!

Gra zawiera: dwie kompletne talie po 55 kart, 28 Å¼etonów dukatów, 15 Å¼etonów kresek oraz instrukcjÄ™.

A roll and move game with numbered spaces by Otto Maier Verlag. Players start at the first space and must follow the numbered spaces in towards the center space. First one to reach the end space is the winner.

The company published a similar game/similar equipment: Reise durch die Schweiz;
due to the used logo ist must have been published earlier than 1892

Bohnanza: Ladies & Gangsters is an English language compilation of two stand-alone Bohnanza games previously available only in German: Ladybohn: Manche mÃ¶gen's heiss! and Al Cabohne.

Ladies is a three- to five-player game that includes female versions of the beans used in Bohnanza. You get more money if a field is harvested with a lady bean as the top card. You get no money if a field is harvested with a baby bean on top. There are some new rules about reordering beans on the fields.

Gangsters is a one- or two-player game where you must pay off the Bean Mafia. Each turn, the Bean Mafia will take beans from your fields if yours match what they are growing. They will also take matching cards when drawn. This game also includes a few new beans with irregular beanometers.
